page.description: The Google Map Component's properties are used to configure the component, including it's initial view, SSL support, custom styling and more.

case.title: Initial Map Type
case.description: The type of Google Map to display. This can be changed by the user using the displayed controls. Choices include *[ui:HYBRID]*, *[ui:ROADMAP]*, *[ui:SATELLITE]*, *[ui:TERRAIN]*.

case.title: Use Google Maps Premier
case.description: Check this if you have a Google Maps Premier client ID and want to use it

case.title: Google Maps Premier Client ID
case.description: Enter your Google Maps Premier client ID

case.title: Use SSL
case.description: Check this if you want to call Google Maps using SSL (HTTPS:)

case.title: Use Sensor
case.description: Check this if you want to use a GPS or other geolocation method for any reason, or if this map is intended to be used on a mobile device.

case.title: Set Initial Position from Sensor
case.description: Check this if you want to use a GPS or other geolocation method to set the initial map center. This works best on mobile devices.

case.title: Initial zoom factor
case.description: The initial zoom factor on the map. This can be changed by the user using the displayed controls. 0 shows the whole world; 20 shows a few square yards. Displaying a circle will override this setting.

case.title: Create marker at initial center
case.description: Check this if you want a push pin and/or polygon vertex created at the initial map center

case.title: Initial marker is draggable
case.description: Check this if you want the initial push pin to be draggable by the user

case.title: Show markers
case.description: Check this if you want push pins displayed.

case.title: Added markers are draggable
case.description: Check this if you want any user-added push pins to be draggable by the user

case.title: Show polygon
case.description: Check this if you want a polygonal area displayed

case.title: Polygon color
case.description: The color used for displaying the Polygon, as hex RGB, e.g. #FF0000

case.title: Maximum number of points
case.description: The maximum number of markers or vertices to display

case.title: Show circle
case.description: Check this if you want a circle displayed

case.title: Circle color
case.description: The color used for displaying the circle, as hex RGB, e.g. #00FF00

case.title: Circle radius
case.description: The radius of the circle to display, in meters. 1 mile is roughly 1609 m. Note that displaying a circle resets the map size.

case.title: Geocoding source
case.description: The service to use for geocoding addresses. Choices include *[ui:Google]*, *[ui:Nominatim]*.

case.title: Reinitialize on Geocode
case.description: Check this if you want to reinitialize the map if the user geocodes an address. Otherwise, the geocoded point will be added to the map.

case.title: Cluster bulk markers
case.description: Check this if you want to display bulk markers in clusters (useful if you have a lot of markers to display)

case.title: Map Width
case.description: The width of the map, e.g. "400px" or "3in"

case.title: Map Height
case.description: The height of the map, e.g. "500px" or "4in"

case.title: Toolbar HTML
case.description: HTML that defines the controls for the toolbar

case.title: Toolbar position
case.description: Specify whether the HTML toolbar is above or below the map. Choices include *[ui:Below]*, *[ui:Above]*.

case.title: Style name
case.description: Click the button to select a new style, or edit the existing style. You can also use <ProjectStyle> or <Session:varname>

case.title: Class map
case.description: Specify how the abstract CSS class names used in this component map to physical CSS class names in your style sheets.

case.title: Resolve abstract CSS class names
case.description: Replace abstract CSS class names with physical CSS class names. This should only be un-checked if you are in development mode and you want to determine what the abstract CSS class name is for a particular element in the component.

case.title: Font size
case.description: Specify if the fonts in the Component should be scaled to make the component larger or smaller. Select 'Medium' for no scaling (i.e. the fonts shown will match those defined in the style sheet). Choices include.

case.title: Font scaling option
case.description: Specify which CSS classes should be scaled. If you choose All, the fonts in these classes will be scaled, in addition to the fonts in the CSS classes specific to the Style that you selected: BODY, TABLE, TH, TR, TD, UL, OL, LI, P, A, BLOCKQUOTE. Choices include *[ui:All]*, *[ui:GridStyleClassesOnly]*.

case.title: Master template
case.description: Specify an optional Master Template. This allows you to place arbitrary HTML surrounding the component.

case.title: Page title
case.description: Specify the page title for the .a5w page that renders this component.

case.title: Local CSS definitions
case.description: Define any local CSS classes. NOTE: You can include SASS syntax in your CSS definition. For more information on SASS syntax see *[extlink:http://sass-lang.com/]*

case.title: Additional component styles
case.description: Specify if any other styles (in addition to the primary style for the component) must be included. Enter a comma delimited list of style names. e.g., GlassOlive,Airport

case.title: CSS Linked files
case.description: Specify any CSS files that should be linked (in addition to the primary style for the Component). Enter a comma delimited list of filenames.

case.title: Local SVG definitions
case.description: Specify any local SVG image definitions you want to include in this component.

case.title: SVG Linked files
case.description: Specify any SVG files that should be linked. Enter a comma delimited list of filenames. Only relative filenames can be specified. Files must be in a folder relative to the webroot.

case.title: Arguments
case.description: Define arguments. Arguments can be bound to page, session and cookie variables. Argument values are passed into all server-side Xbasic event handlers in the component.

case.title: Javascript Linked files
case.description: Specify any Javascript files that should be linked. Enter a comma delimited list of filenames.

case.title: Xbasic Linked files
case.description: Specify any Xbasic Function Library files that should be linked. Enter a comma delimited list of filenames. Defining Xbasic functions in a Function Library (that can be shared among multiple components) is an alternative to defining your Xbasic functions in this component (see 'Xbasic functions' on the toolbox).

case.title: Language definitions
case.description: Define strings for different languages.

case.title: Text dictionary tags
case.description: Show Text Dictionary tags (<a5:t>...</a5:t>) used in this component.

case.title: Active language
case.description: Specify the active language to use for translating strings tagged with <a5:r>..</a5:r> tags. Setting the property here is useful for testing purposes. In a real application you can set the 'session.__protected__activeLanguage' variable to specify the active language. To select the default language, enter <Default> or leave this property blank.

case.title: Remove un-consumed language tags
case.description: Should any language tags that were not replaced (because they were not defined in the Language Definition) be removed from any output sent to the browser?

case.title: Head section tags
case.description: Specify any tags you want to appear in the HEAD section of the page that hosts this component.

case.title: Component must run in IFrame
case.description: Specify if this component must run in its own IFrame.

case.title: IFrame inline style
case.description: Specify the in-line style for the IFrame. You should set a height and width for the IFrame. e.g. width: 6in; height 4in;

case.title: Other properties
case.description: Specify other properties of the component

description.p: Specify if the component should be saved as a binary file or as formatted JSON.

Formatted JSON saves the properties in clear text. This is useful if you are using some type of source or version control system and the system has a method to show differences between versions. Choices include *[ui:Binary]*, *[ui:Formatted JSON]*.
